CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property;Violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , a town in LOC .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Ust - Labinskiy ORG awarded the applicant MONEY against a local welfare authority for a delayed payment of social benefits . This judgment became binding on DATE , but has not been enforced to date .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted enforcement papers to bailiffs , and on DATE the bailiffs passed the papers to the ORG . In DATE the ORG returned the papers to the applicant , because in the meantime the procedure of enforcement had changed .

CARDINAL . To vindicate his right to a timely enforcement of the judgment , the applicant sued bailiffs for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damages . On DATE ORG rejected this claim , having found that the bailiffs had done everything they should have done to enforce the judgment .
CARDINAL . Under LAW of DATE , a bailiff must enforce a judgment within DATE . Under section QUANTITY of LAW of DATE , ORG must enforce a judgment within DATE .
